text: Audra Marie Lindley (September 24, 1918 â€“ October 16, 1997) was an American actress. She was most famous for her role as landlady Helen Roper on the sitcom Three's Company and its spin-off The Ropers. She was born in Los Angeles. From 1972 to 1979, she was married to actor James Whitmore. Lindley died of leukemia on October 16, 1997 at a Los Angeles hospital, aged 79. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:1997 deaths Category:Deaths from leukemia Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from Los Angeles
title: Audra Lindley
